noun.description: The male parent of an animal, especially a stallion or bull kept for breeding.
examples: the sire is one of the country's top thoroughbred stallions

noun.description: A respectful form of address for someone of high social status, especially a king.

verb.description: Be the male parent of (an animal)
examples: Castor twice sired two champions in a litter

origin: Middle English (in sire (sense 2 of the noun)): from Old French, from an alteration of Latin senior (see senior). sire (sense 1 of the noun) dates from the early 16th century.
